title: What a Great Group of Developers and their Products are Excellent
comment: We have been working with the Developers of Avare for the past six month on a project soon to be released as a Beta Trial for VFR Pilots. Let me tell you how responsive they are to our request, when they say their product is built by pilots for pilots they really mean it, and that is why their product is so good.  They have responded, normally within hours, to our requests or bug reports.  Along the way on our project, we have introduce Avare to our friends and they are really impressed, that is too bad for some of the major GPS providers, because they have decided to use Avare instead.  The ease of use and verity of features rival all the other GPS's out there for General Aviation pilots.   In hundreds of hours of trial time using Avare I have never encountered a problem that caused me to distrust or close down the application.   I can't say the same for other apps, so please rest assured that using Avare will be a positive experience for your aviation GPS needs. I also want to add a note, based on my experience as an Instrument Ground Instructor.  Avare had the foresight to integrate with X-Plane so that you can practice the use of Avare in the safety of you simulator! Use it.

title: Amazing free app! (500-hr VFR  private pilot, Galaxy S4 smartphone)
comment: I just used this on a 3-leg x-country, and I found myself relying more on it than my older Garmin panel mount GPS.. I love the beautiful VFR sectionals, and the accuracy is fantastic,. The UI is very easy to navigate with all the detail of the printed versions at your fingertips. There were several TFRs in the region and it was great to have them so prominently displayed.  The only issues I had were:  1) when using a multi-waypoint plan, it did not want to update the next leg after passing a waypoint. Had to resort to "direct-to." 2) when using the "North up" feature it sometimes struggled to redraw the sectional. 3) inputting/activating flight plans is not as intuitive as it might be.  In spite of those issues, which I'm sure they will work out, I;m giving this 5 stars. Many thanks to the developers Where do I donate?.

comment: Just downloaded Beta 3.5 with Terminal Plates...works great!  Better than many paid apps! Thank you for the response to add the ability to download ALL Terminal Procedures!

title: Best Android moving map
comment: Avare is getting better with each new release, and the best available android moving map. Bravo!

title: Decent
comment: Getting better every release! Looks like approach plates are coming soon. One request would be the ability to put the display into portrait mode, and show the diagrams in portrait regardless, since they fit better this way.

title: Amazing!
comment: By far the best aviation app I have come across, and the price can't be beat! Thanks for your hard work!

title: Love it
comment: Very handy

title: Outstanding Programming, Top App,  Great Support!
comment: As an old time pilot and air navigation program writer, I was blown away with what Zubair has accomplished in a very short time.  He has been very responsive to suggestions and plans further upgrades to make this outstanding product even better.  Having been in his shoes years ago, I am amazed at what he has done.  Although the app is free, I was compelled to make a contribution and urge other users to do so too.  His considerable effort deserves your generous donation to help him go further.  Look no further... this is the one for your air navigation needs.

title: Works good
comment: Using a Samsung galaxy note and it works fine. Found a few problems in the AFD part (said there was a parallel runway when there wasn't) but the sectionals and airport diagrams are correct! Thanks guys

title: Excellent
comment: Easy to use. Does not require paid subscription, no ads. Computing the distance and bearing between any two points on the map would be a nice feature.

title: Pilot
comment: Great GPS on a sectional

title: Just Awesome.
comment: It's great to finally find an android VFR map app that feels like it was written by a competent programmer.  I used it on a 3 hour flight today and it worked flawlessly.

title: Great app
comment: App is fantastic.  Make sure your charts are updated or else your location may appear offset/inaccurate.

title: Not of much use
comment: App has a flaw that attempts to update itself over and over again.

title: Great Aviation App
comment: Great program for viewing sectionals, airport information and flight navigation. I made a suggestion to the developer for a product improvement and they made it available the next day. Great support and responsiveness.

title: Super App for pilots
comment: Super app for Android. A true moving map and it is currently free. It blows away Google pilot. Try it and you'll love it.  John

title: My Thanks to the developers
comment: I want to thank the developers for their work and their generosity in making this program free.  It performs flawless and seamless once the sectionals are downloaded.  In fact, I just purchased a rather expensive electronic flight bag expecting it to work similar to AVARE.  I was disappointed that my newly purchased EFB was not as seamless or fast as AVARE.  I have to go to a page to open up either the north half or the south half of a sectional.  AVARE does this all seamlessly as you simply scroll down the map.  Hit the screen twice and you are back at your geo referenced position.  I also by accident saw that the automatic airport weather was provided when I was online, as well as the TFR areas.   My only wishes for this developer are: 1) permit zaon and/or ADS-B traffic overlay, 2) permit overlay of nexrad radar, and 3) give us some idea of what amount of donation we can make.    This is a wonderful app for any pilot.  Thanks again!

title: Frugal VFR Pilot Approved
comment: I fly approx. 25 VFR hours per yr, I need a stable and reliable GPS aide on my ASUS Transformer TF101, this did the jobs

title: Unbelievable.
comment: Unbelievable because the technology has gotten to the point that we can have this kind of resolution and accuracy in our pockets. Unbelievable because if you have your phone with you in the cockpit, you have an emergency backup to positional awareness (important in a glass cockpit that goes dark). And finally, unbelievable that it's free.  Nice work.

title: Nice job.
comment: A lot of functionality. Very professional feedback from the developer to one of my posts. Rapid improvements with updates.

title: Just used it for a flight to Florida Keys
comment: This software worked perfectly during my flight. It took a bit of time to acquire GPS, but I blame my device. Next time I'll use an xgps and see how it goes. If I were to request a feature, it would be 'always on'. Used it on the new Nexus 7.

title: Great sectionals
comment: Great response from developer on enhancements when I have communicated with him. If you can believe this I got 2 hour response and fix!

title: Free and works great
comment: I love it for planning and even in flight. Weather is great. Excellent seamless charts. Free.

title: Wow what an app
comment: Excellent vfr moving maps. Great performance on my very old phone and free!!! TACs too. And weather and AFD.

title: Poor performance
comment: Good idea & free, but charting not good.  OpenFlightGPS charting works much better on Xoom, but its downloading is buggy.

title: Incredible
comment: This is better than any of the paid apps, it's constantly updated and works flawlessly.

title: Love it!
comment: My husband is a pilot, and I can now look at charts and even help him sometimes! I've had AF/D info for him instantly, and he was happy once when I handed him my phone to check position when he wanted to keep the 430 display on something else. He's shopping for a tablet now to fly with Avare. Can't wait to show him the new features!

title: Simply the best seamless VFR sectional maps FREE!!
comment: Every version get better.  Works great on Google Nexus 7 and Motorola Triumph.  The fact that it is open source is icing on the cake.  I hope to see more chart types and advanced flight planning in the future.     Thanks guys!

title: HTC Incredible 2
comment: So far I've only tried it on the ground and on an airline flight. Worked good until I lost GPS signal.  One thing that would be great to add is a list of downloaded charts and when they expire.

title: HTC EVO 3D
comment: I'm not sure if this is a user error, phone or product issue. Installed on HTC EVO 3D. I entered a BASE. No problem. I cannot enter a "destination". I get prompted with "destination not found" every time. I noticed the demo has a "DONE" button. The HTC phone does not. The "carriage return" is the only button which will enter the data and return the screen to map view. Maybe it's the problem.

title: User friendly no ads, maps free
comment: Used on HTC vivid. Works just fine and only features that are important. Although it would be nice to give a prompt when GPS is disabled

title: Great idea and best free VFR maps app
comment: This is a great alternative (*free*) to other VFR chart options. Easy to use and I don't have to carry paper maps anymore. Please add options to keep maps updated. Works great on Nexus 7 and GPS have to be enabled to get maps loaded.
